comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The revolution that deposed the monarch in Portugal was in 1910 -- see en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_Portugal. March 9, 1916 was the day Germany declared War on Portugal in WWI. See www.history.com/this-day-in-history/germany-declares-war-... Perhaps Bain dug up earlier photos for use after this and that's why a "revolution" photo is in this batch.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: About the revolution in Portugal of 1910 see also en.wikipedia.org/wiki/5_October_1910_revolution There never was a German invasion in Portugal, but a battle between Portuguese and German forces in Belgium. I think these photographs are just mislabelled.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: @B-59. Thanks for the correction. I didn't read carefully enough. The Keowee courier., October 12, 1910, page 3. cols 1&2 (and other news of the time) chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn84026912/1910-10-12/ed-... mentions Red Cross ambulances in the streets of Lisbon. The fragments of signs look Portuguese. So this photo might have been taken in Lisbon in 1910.
